title: OpenVAS in Docker
description: Installing Docker then OpenVAS and testing by checking for vulnerabilities.
objective: Learn how to set up OpenVAS using Docker and conduct vulnerability scans, then interpret the results.
steps: Install Docker on Linux-based (Kali Linux) virtual machine.
Set up a Windows virtual machine (Windows 7) as the target for the scan.
Use OpenVAS to conduct a vulnerability scan on the Windows VM.
results: OpenVAS loads over 40,000 NVTs and over 100,000 CVEs. Each vulnerability is assigned a different severity level.

challenges.problem: Docker container failed to start due to port conflicts.
challenges.solution: Mapped OpenVAS ports to available host ports.
Updated NVT database and reran the scan.
